remarks: Two ways to say that a function in maps-to notation is single-rooted. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-Mar-2017.)
statement:
funcnvmpt.0 $e |- F/ x ph $.
funcnvmpt.1 $e |- F/_ x A $.
funcnvmpt.2 $e |- F/_ x F $.
funcnvmpt.3 $e |- F = ( x e. A |-> B ) $.
funcnvmpt.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. V ) $.
funcnv4mpt $p |- ( ph -> ( Fun `' F <-> A. i e. A A. j e. A ( i = j \/ [_ i / x ]_ B =/= [_ j / x ]_ B ) ) ) $.
$d A i j $.
$d B i j $.
$d F i $.
$d V x $.
$d i j ph $.
$d i j x $.
